references.paper_title: Regret bounds for the adaptive control of linear quadratic systems
references.reason: This paper provides foundational regret bounds for adaptive control of linear quadratic systems, a crucial concept in the current research.
This paper presents the first non-asymptotic results for online control under adversarial disturbances, directly relevant to the current work's focus on non-stochastic settings.

references.paper_title: Logarithmic regret for episodic continuous-time linear-quadratic reinforcement learning over a finite-time horizon
references.reason: This paper is highly relevant as it examines online continuous-time linear quadratic control achieving sublinear regret, addressing a similar problem but under different noise assumptions.
This work provides a significant advancement in online linear quadratic control, offering valuable insights and techniques applicable to continuous-time systems.
This paper is highly relevant as it provides a framework for analyzing non-stochastic control problems, which is directly addressed in the current work.
